newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING NO COMMENT ON CREDITANSTALT TALK.
newsitem.headline: ING NO COMMENT ON CREDITANSTALT TALK.

text.p: Dutch financial services group ING Groep NV (ING) said on Thursday it had no comment on speculation it may be interested in the Austrian state's 70 percent voting stake in Creditanstalt-Bankverein .
"The actual comment is that we never comment on those rumours," ING spokesman Wieger Sietsma told Reuters.
The Austrian government has said it will sell its stake in the nation's flagship bank this calendar year, with two bidders taking part in the due diligence process.
A consortium led by Austro-Italian insurer EA-Generali is the only known bidder.
ING has said it is interested in expanding in the emerging markets of Eastern Europe, but not in established markets.
In this region, it has operations in Hungary and Poland.
